setting.location: Research laboratory aboard station orbiting planet Solaris
setting.weather: Artificial atmosphere disturbed by violent outburst

characters.appearance: Man, early 30s, brown hair completely disheveled, face red with fury and streaked with tears
characters.clothing: Station uniform torn and stained, collar ripped from violent movement
characters.position: Standing among destroyed equipment, fists still clenched from violence
characters.action: Having just finished destroying laboratory equipment in rage, now standing amid wreckage, chest heaving with grief and exhaustion

scene.mainElements: Laboratory equipment scattered and broken across floor, screens cracked and dark, scientific instruments destroyed in emotional explosion
scene.details: Broken glass and metal debris scattered everywhere, overturned chairs and tables, sparking electrical connections from damaged equipment, papers scattered like fallen leaves, no text or letters visible
scene.background: Laboratory walls showing impact damage, emergency lighting activated, glimpses of other equipment stations left untouched, station continuing to function despite personal destruction
scene.atmosphere: Explosive grief after devastating loss, violence as only outlet for unbearable emotional pain, complete breakdown of scientific rationality, raw human emotion destroying technological environment

composition.cameraAngle: Wide shot showing extent of destruction and solitary figure
composition.focus: Character surrounded by wreckage of his attempt to understand
composition.depth: Destroyed equipment scattered in foreground, grieving figure in middle ground, damaged laboratory extending into background

colorPalette.usageNotes: Cool tones dominate with pops of vibrant neon lighting

lineArt.texture: smooth digital, hard edges on tech

lighting.intensity: high contrast (bright neon vs deep shadow)
lighting.highlights: lens flares, neon glows on surfaces

rendering.texture: smooth with textured brushes for atmosphere
rendering.detailLevel: high in focal points (tech details), looser elsewhere

perspective: dynamic perspective (wide-angle vistas or low-angle hero shots)
